$1 is a variable name, $2 and $3 are data types.

Error returned by validator of Growth config

growthexperiments-edit-config-disabled:
Error displayed by Special:EditGrowthConfig when community configuration is disabled

{{doc-growthexperiments-community-configuration}}
growthexperiments-edit-config-last-edit:
Last updated header in Special:EditGrowthConfig. Will be displayed for all pages Special:EditGrowthConfig is capable of editing.

Parameters:
* $1 – username of revision author
* $2 - time of last update in relative format (eg. 3 days ago)
* $3 – page title the edit changed
* $4 – difflink to the edit

{{doc-growthexperiments-community-configuration}}
growthexperiments-edit-config-last-edit-:
Last updated header in Special:EditGrowthConfig when the username is not known

Parameters:
* $1 – time of last update in relative format (eg. 3 days ago)
* $2 – page title the edit changed
* $3 – difflink to the edit

{{doc-growthexperiments-community-configuration}}
growthexperiments-edit-config-pretext:

Parameters: 
* $1 – list of pages Special:EditGrowthConfig can edit, with links

growthexperiments-edit-config-pretext-ba:

* $1 - name of the page where the banner module can be configured.

communityconfiguration-communityupdates-: Description of the Community configuration editor form for the Community updates homepage module
The message describes that the Community updates module is a feature available in the newcomer homepage, and it serves to discover initiatives relevant for newcomers.
Headline of the Community configuration editor form for the Community updates homepage module
Label for the Community updates module enabling checkbox
Label for the Community updates module field setting the title content text
Label for the Community updates module field description setting the title content text
Label for the Community updates module field setting the body content text
Label for the Community updates module field description setting the body content text
Label for the Community updates module field setting the minimum number of edits a user must have to be shown the Community updates banner
Label for the Community updates module field setting an image for the update banner
Label for the Community updates module field description setting an image for the update banner
Field label for Call to action in Community configuration
Label for the destination page link field in the Community Updates configuration form.

Help-text for the destination page link field in the Community Updates configuration form. The example page mentioned in the help-text does not exist. It is there to show how to create a link to meta-wiki. That is, without brackets and with the meta: prefix.
Label for the call to action button text field in the Community Updates configuration form.
Label for the dark mode background for thumbnails checkbox in the Community Updates configuration form.
Help text for the dark mode background for thumbnails checkbox in the Community Updates configuration form.
communityconfiguration-helppanel-title: Headline of the Community configuration module for the help panel
communityconfiguration-helppanel-descrip: Description of the Community configuration module for the help panel
communityconfiguration-helppanel-info-te:
The message describes that the Help panel is a feature available in any namespace, both in reading and edit mode. It provides useful functionality, including search for help, clickable help links, and the ability to ask questions to mentors or the help desk. The panel displays links which can be configured to point to any relevant wiki pages.

The words "view more" are a shortened form of {{msg-mw|Growthexperiments-help-panel-editing-help-links-widget-view-more-link}}.

communityconfiguration-growthhomepage-in: This message explains the Newcomer homepage offers guidance for new account holders. When a new user registers and expresses interest in creating an article or adding a new image to Wikipedia, it is recommended they begin with a smaller edit to get started. Additionally, the homepage provides a link to further guidance.

communityconfiguration-growthsuggesteded: Headline of the Community configuration module for suggested edits
Description of the Community configuration module for suggested edits

This message explains the purpose and limitations of the Suggested Edits feature for newcomers. It informs users that Suggested Edits help newcomers start editing and are available on the web and mobile web via the Newcomer Homepage. It also highlights that changes made through the community configuration will not affect Suggested Edits within the Wikipedia iOS and Android Apps and provides a link to the Apps team's talk page for further discussion. The "Newcomer task" tag name must be consistent with {{msg-mw|Tag-newcomer task}}.
